78
that I could not help coveting the
like for you - But upon inquiry
I find wages impracticable -
a good cook & housekeeper from £25 to £30
a Butler such as I see here good 40 - not a
penny less - finding their own clothes
a housemaid - good - not under 10 and
usually from ten to fourteen
finding their own tea & sugar -

- I must put all this as you
will say out of my head - & so I will if
I can - But I do so long for your
comfort dear mother that you
had even two good servants
cook - & butler - for credit - care
and really Economy as well as comfort
- if one could but afford it - "I beg
your pardon" - "for what what my dear?"

Thank you for the lines you
crammed in at the end of your letter
about the Lord Bishop Higgins &
the Pope & the prayers of his Holiness
for OConnell - this made Mr Moil
lietMoilliet laugh till he cried - he could not have
believed it he said unless it had
come from such good authority

It is very amusing to me to hear
his odd ignorant, inconsistent, bene-
volentbenevolent, intolerant, liberal almost ra-
dicalradical opinions all mixed up together
frying & hissing within him & boiling over sometimes
- He conceives that Ireland is still
a dreadfully persecuted country - treated
quite as a conquered country - shockingly
therefore he cannot but wish for the repeal
of the Union to set Ireland free at last
- It is so horridly unjust he says that she Ireland
should be oppressed by the English debt
But then I tell him England does not
tax us - and opens her markets to us
&c But still says he she is insulted
as a conquered country has no parliament of
her own - & was taken from her by the Union

There must be a repeal of that Union
stamping about on the hearth
(and the tear full in his eye about nothing)

- Then your Irish tenants are so
cruelly oppressed by your Irish landlord
There must be a redress of grievances
& fixity of tenure
Stay till you hear more - A
commission is now appointed in
ParlParliament? & you will find that our tenants
rights are respected & that they may
have fixity of tenure without more ado
If you mean certainly that their
farms will be relet to them & input allowed

If you mean by fixity of tenure that
all the tenants shd remain in fixed possession
of the landlords property the landlord
must have Income because they
cannot live upon nothing - Both
catholic & protestant landlords must go

At the word Catholic quite a
new train of ideas are in Mr Moilliets
mind - Observe the Catholics are
his great plagues at Geneva where
they are now all at sixes & sevens

He cant abide a Catholic priest - he
turns short round, and
throws his hands out as if pushing
the idea of a Catholic priest from him
with abhorrence - But the seven millions
of Catholic poor I own he thinks should have
perfect toleration & emancipation I tell him they have - only
May none can be ArchhArchbishop of CantyCanterbury or York
and cannot be Generals of the armies
